DEM class to read and interpolate DEMs

   1"""cpom.dems.dems.py
   2
   3DEM class to read and interpolate DEMs

   8import logging

  18from pyproj import Transformer  # transforms
  19from rasterio.errors import RasterioIOError
  20from scipy.interpolate import RegularGridInterpolator, interpn
  21from scipy.ndimage import gaussian_filter
  22from tifffile import imread  # to support large TIFF files

  33# List of supported DEMs
  34#   - add to this list if you add a new DEM in the Dem class
  35dem_list = [
  36    "awi_ant_1km",  # AWI (2014) DEM of Antarctica from CS2. Helm et al.
  37    "awi_grn_1km",  # AWI (2014) DEM of Greenland from CS2. Helm et al.
  38    "awi_ant_1km_grounded",  # awi_ant_1km but masked for grounded ice only, from Bedmachine v2 mask
  39    "awi_ant_1km_floating",  # awi_ant_1km but masked for floating ice only from Bedmachine v2 mask
  40    "rema_ant_1km",  # Antarctic REMA v1.1 at 1km
  41    "rema_ant_1km_zarr",  # Antarctic REMA v1.1 at 1km
  42    "rema_ant_1km_v2",  # Antarctic REMA v2.0 at 1km
  43    "rema_ant_1km_v2_zarr",  # Antarctic REMA v2.0 at 1km in zarr format
  44    "rema_ant_200m",  # Antarctic REMA v1.1 at 200m
  45    "rema_ant_200m_zarr",  # Antarctic REMA v1.1 at 200m, zarr format
  46    "rema_gapless_100m",  # REMA (v1.1)Gapless DEM Antarctica at 100m,:
  47    "rema_gapless_100m_zarr",  # REMA (v1.1)Gapless DEM Antarctica at 100m, Zarr format:
  48    # https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isprsjprs.2022.01.024
  49    "rema_gapless_1km",  # REMA (v1.1)Gapless DEM Antarctica at 1km,:
  50    "rema_gapless_1km_zarr",  # REMA (v1.1)Gapless DEM Antarctica at 1km,:
  51    # https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isprsjprs.2022.01.024
  52    "arcticdem_1km",  # ArcticDEM v3.0 at 1km
  53    "arcticdem_1km_zarr",  # ArcticDEM v3.0 at 1km, Zarr format
  54    "arcticdem_1km_v4.1",  # ArcticDEM v4.1 at 1km
  55    "arcticdem_1km_greenland_v4.1",  # ArcticDEM v4.1 at 1km, subarea greenland
  56    "arcticdem_1km_greenland_v4.1_zarr",  # ArcticDEM v4.1 at 1km, subarea greenland
  57    "arcticdem_100m_greenland",  # ArcticDEM v3.0, 100m resolution, subarea greenland
  58    "arcticdem_100m_greenland_v4.1",  # ArcticDEM v4.1, 100m resolution, subarea greenland
  59    "arcticdem_100m_greenland_v4.1_zarr",  # Zarr format of ArcticDEM v4.1, 100m resolution, grn
  60    "atl14_grn_100m_004_003_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_GL_0324_100m_004_03.nc
  61    "atl14_ant_100m_004_004_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_A(1-4)_0324_100m_004_04.nc
  62    "atl14_ant_a1_100m_004_004_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_A1_0324_100m_004_04.nc (AIS NE)
  63    "atl14_ant_a2_100m_004_004_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_A2_0324_100m_004_04.nc (AIS NW)
  64    "atl14_ant_a3_100m_004_004_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_A3_0324_100m_004_04.nc (AIS SW)
  65    "atl14_ant_a4_100m_004_004_zarr",  # Zarr format of IS/IS2 ATL14_A4_0324_100m_004_04.nc (AIS SE)
  66]

  69class Dem:
  70    """class to load and interpolate Polar DEMs"""
  71
  72    # pylint: disable=too-many-instance-attributes
  73
  74    def __init__(
  75        self,
  76        name: str,
  77        filled: bool = True,
  78        config: None | dict = None,
  79        dem_dir: str | None = None,
  80        store_in_shared_memory: bool = False,
  81        thislog: logging.Logger | None = None,
  82    ):
  83        """class initialization function
  84
  85        Args:
  86            name (str): DEM name id, must be in global dem_list
  87            filled (bool, optional): Use filled version of DEM if True. Defaults to True.
  88            config (dict, optional): configuration dictionary, defaults to None
  89            dem_dir (str, optional): path of directory containing DEM. Defaults to None
  90            store_in_shared_memory (bool, optional): stores/accesses zdem array in SharedMemory
  91            thislog (logging.Logger|None, optional): attach to a different log instance
  92        Raises:
  93            ValueError: when name not in global dem_list
  94        """
  95        self.name = name
  96        self.crs_wgs = CRS("epsg:4326")  # we are using WGS84 for all DEMs
  97        self.config = config
  98        self.name = name
  99        self.dem_dir = dem_dir
 100        self.filled = filled
 101        self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 102        self.xdem = np.array([])
 103        self.ydem = np.array([])
 104        self.zdem: zarr.core.Array | np.ndarray = np.array([])
 105        self.zdem_flip: zarr.core.Array | np.ndarray = np.array([])
 106        self.mindemx = None
 107        self.mindemy = None
 108        self.binsize = 0
 109        self.store_in_shared_memory = store_in_shared_memory
 110        self.shape = ()
 111        self.dtype = np.float32
 112        self.shared_mem: Any = None
 113        self.shared_mem_child = False  # set to True if a child process
 114        self.npz_type = False  # set to True when using .npz DEM file
 115        self.zarr_type = False  # set to True when using .zarr DEM file
 116        self.nc_type = False  # set to True when using .nc DEM file
 117        self.zflip = True  # whether self.zdem needs flipping
 118        self.void_value: float | int = -3267
 119
 120        # is accessing the Dem's shared memory
 121        # default is False (parent process which allocates
 122        # the shared memory). Necessary for tracking who
 123        # unlinks (parent) or closes (child) the shared
 124        # memory at the end
 125        if thislog is not None:
 126            self.log = thislog  # optionally attach to a different log instance
 127        else:
 128            self.log = log
 129
 130        if name not in dem_list:
 131            self.log.error("DEM %s not in allowed list", name)
 132            raise ValueError(f"DEM name {name} not in allowed list")
 133
 134        self.load()
 135
 136    def get_nc_extent(self, fname: str):
 137        """get the DEM extent from nc file
 138
 139        Args:
 140            fname (str): path of GeoTIFF file
 141
 142        Raises:
 143            ValueError: _description_
 144            IOError: _description_
 145
 146        Returns:
 147            tuple(int,int,int,int,int,int,int): width,height,top_left,top_right,bottom_left,
 148            bottom_right,pixel_width
 149        """
 150
 151        nc = Dataset(fname)
 152        height, width = np.shape(nc["h"])
 153        top_left = (np.min(nc["x"][:]), np.max(nc["y"][:]))
 154        top_right = (np.max(nc["x"][:]), np.max(nc["y"][:]))
 155        bottom_left = (np.min(nc["x"][:]), np.min(nc["y"][:]))
 156        bottom_right = (np.max(nc["y"][:]), np.min(nc["y"][:]))
 157        pixel_width = nc["x"][:][1] - nc["x"][:][0]
 158
 159        print(
 160            width,
 161            height,
 162            top_left,
 163            top_right,
 164            bottom_left,
 165            bottom_right,
 166            pixel_width,
 167        )
 168
 169        return (
 170            width,
 171            height,
 172            top_left,
 173            top_right,
 174            bottom_left,
 175            bottom_right,
 176            pixel_width,
 177        )
 178
 179    def get_geotiff_extent(self, fname: str):
 180        """Get info from GeoTIFF on its extent
 181
 182        Args:
 183            fname (str): path of GeoTIFF file
 184
 185        Raises:
 186            ValueError: _description_
 187            IOError: _description_
 188
 189        Returns:
 190            tuple(int,int,int,int,int,int,int): width,height,top_left,top_right,bottom_left,
 191            bottom_right,pixel_width
 192        """
 193        try:
 194            with rasterio.open(fname) as dataset:
 195                transform = dataset.transform
 196                width = dataset.width
 197                height = dataset.height
 198
 199                top_left = transform * (0, 0)
 200                top_right = transform * (width, 0)
 201                bottom_left = transform * (0, height)
 202                bottom_right = transform * (width, height)
 203
 204                pixel_width = transform[0]
 205                pixel_height = -transform[4]  # Negative because the height is
 206                # typically negative in GeoTIFFs
 207                if int(pixel_width) != int(pixel_height):
 208                    raise ValueError(f"pixel_width {pixel_width} != pixel_height {pixel_height}")
 209        except RasterioIOError as exc:
 210            raise IOError(f"Could not read GeoTIFF: {exc}") from exc
 211        return (
 212            width,
 213            height,
 214            top_left,
 215            top_right,
 216            bottom_left,
 217            bottom_right,
 218            pixel_width,
 219        )
 220
 221    def get_filename(self, default_dir: str, filename: str, filled_filename: str) -> str:
 222        """Find the path of the DEM file from dir and file names :
 223        For the directory, it is chosen in order of preference:
 224        a) self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name], or
 225        b) supplied self.dem_dir, or
 226        c) default_dir
 227        The file name is:
 228        filename: is self.filled use filled_filename
 229
 230        Args:
 231            default_dir (str): default dir to find DEM file names
 232            filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
 233            filled_filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
 234        Returns:
 235            str : path of DEM file
 236        Raises:
 237            OSError : directory or file not found
 238        """
 239        this_dem_dir = None
 240        if self.config:
 241            if "dem_dirs" in self.config and self.name in self.config["dem_dirs"]:
 242                this_dem_dir = self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name]
 243        if this_dem_dir is None and self.dem_dir:
 244            this_dem_dir = self.dem_dir
 245        if this_dem_dir is None:
 246            this_dem_dir = default_dir
 247
 248        if not os.path.isdir(this_dem_dir):
 249            raise OSError(f"{this_dem_dir} not found")
 250        if self.filled and filled_filename:
 251            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filled_filename}"
 252        else:
 253            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filename}"
 254
 255        self.log.info("Loading dem name: %s", self.name)
 256        self.log.info("Loading dem file: %s", this_path)
 257
 258        if self.zarr_type:
 259            if not os.path.isdir(this_path):
 260                raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
 261        elif not os.path.isfile(this_path):
 262            raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
 263
 264        return this_path
 265
 266    def clean_up(self):
 267        """Free up, close or release any shared memory or other resources associated
 268        with DEM
 269        """
 270        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
 271            try:
 272                if self.shared_mem is not None:
 273                    if self.shared_mem_child:
 274                        self.shared_mem.close()
 275                        self.log.info("closed shared memory for %s", self.name)
 276                    else:
 277                        self.shared_mem.close()
 278                        self.shared_mem.unlink()
 279                        self.log.info("unlinked shared memory for %s", self.name)
 280
 281            except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-exception-caught
 282                self.log.error("Shared memory for %s could not be closed %s", self.name, exc)
 283        else:
 284            if self.zarr_type:
 285                self.zdem = None
 286                self.zdem_flip = None
 287
 288    def load_npz(self, npz_file: str):
 289        """Load DEM from npz format file
 290
 291        Args:
 292            npz_file (str): path of npz file
 293        """
 294        data = np.load(npz_file, allow_pickle=True)
 295        self.zdem = data["zdem"]
 296        self.xdem = data["xdem"]
 297        self.ydem = data["ydem"]
 298        self.mindemx = data["mindemx"]
 299        self.mindemy = data["mindemy"]
 300        self.binsize = data["binsize"]
 301
 302    def load_zarr(self, demfile: str):
 303        """Load a .zarr file
 304
 305        Args:
 306            demfile (str): path of .zarr file
 307        """
 308
 309        try:
 310            self.zdem = zarr.open_array(demfile, mode="r")
 311        except Exception as exc:
 312            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc
 313
 314        ncols = self.zdem.attrs["ncols"]
 315        nrows = self.zdem.attrs["nrows"]
 316
 317        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
 318
 319        for key in self.zdem.attrs:
 320            print(key, self.zdem.attrs[key])
 321
 322        top_l = self.zdem.attrs["top_l"]
 323        top_r = self.zdem.attrs["top_r"]
 324        bottom_l = self.zdem.attrs["bottom_l"]
 325        binsize = self.zdem.attrs["binsize"]
 326
 327        print(
 328            ncols,
 329            nrows,
 330            top_l,
 331            top_r,
 332            bottom_l,
 333            binsize,
 334        )
 335
 336        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 337        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 338        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 339        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 340        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 341        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 342
 343        try:
 344            self.zdem_flip = zarr.open_array(demfile.replace(".zarr", "_flipped.zarr"), mode="r")
 345        except Exception as exc:
 346            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc
 347
 348    def load_nc(self, demfile: str):
 349        """Load a netcdf file
 350
 351        Args:
 352            demfile (str): path of netcdf file
 353        """
 354        (
 355            ncols,
 356            nrows,
 357            top_l,
 358            top_r,
 359            bottom_l,
 360            _,
 361            binsize,
 362        ) = self.get_nc_extent(demfile)
 363
 364        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
 365
 366        nc = Dataset(demfile)
 367        zdem = nc["h"][:].data
 368
 369        if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 370            raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
 371        self.zdem = zdem
 372
 373        # Set void data to Nan
 374        if self.void_value:
 375            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
 376            if np.any(void_data):
 377                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
 378
 379        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 380        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 381        # self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 382        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 383        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 384        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 385
 386    def load_geotiff(self, demfile: str):
 387        """Load a GeoTIFF file
 388
 389        Args:
 390            demfile (str): path of GeoTIFF
 391        """
 392        (
 393            ncols,
 394            nrows,
 395            top_l,
 396            top_r,
 397            bottom_l,
 398            _,
 399            binsize,
 400        ) = self.get_geotiff_extent(demfile)
 401
 402        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
 403            # First try attaching to an existing shared memory buffer if it
 404            # exists with the DEMs name. If that is unavailable, create the shared memory
 405            try:
 406                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=False)
 407                self.zdem = np.ndarray(
 408                    shape=(nrows, ncols), dtype=self.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf
 409                )
 410                self.shared_mem_child = True
 411
 412                self.log.info("attached to existing shared memory for %s ", self.name)
 413
 414            except FileNotFoundError as exc:
 415                zdem = imread(demfile)
 416
 417                if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 418                    raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}") from exc
 419
 420                # Create the shared memory with the appropriate size
 421                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=True, size=zdem.nbytes)
 422
 423                # Link the shared memory to the zdem data
 424                self.zdem = np.ndarray(zdem.shape, dtype=zdem.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf)
 425
 426                # Copy the data from zdem to the shared_np_array
 427                self.zdem[:] = zdem[:]
 428
 429                self.log.info("created shared memory for %s", self.name)
 430        else:
 431            zdem = imread(demfile)
 432            if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 433                raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
 434            self.zdem = zdem
 435
 436        # Set void data to Nan
 437        if self.void_value:
 438            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
 439            if np.any(void_data):
 440                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
 441
 442        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 443        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 444        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 445        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 446        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 447        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 448
 449    def load(self) -> bool:
 450        """load the DEM
 451
 452        Returns:
 453            bool: DEM loaded ok (True), failed (False)
 454        """
 455        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 456        if self.name == "awi_ant_1km":
 457            filename = "DEM_ANT_CS_20130901.tif"
 458            filled_filename = "DEM_ANT_CS_20130901.tif"
 459            default_dir = f'{os.environ["CPDATA_DIR"]}/SATS/RA/DEMS/ant_awi_2013_dem'
 460            self.src_url = (
 461                "http://data.pgc.umn.edu/elev/dem/setsm/REMA/mosaic/v1.1/1km/REMA_1km_dem.tif"
 462            )
 463            self.src_url_filled = (
 464                "http://data.pgc.umn.edu/elev/dem/setsm/REMA/mosaic/v1.1/1km/"
 465                "REMA_1km_dem_filled.tif"
 466            )
 467            self.dem_version = "1.0"
 468            self.src_institute = "AWI"
 469            self.long_name = "AWI Antarctic DEM (2013)"
 470            self.crs_bng = CRS("epsg:3031")  # Polar Stereo - South -71S
 471            self.southern_hemisphere = True
 472            self.void_value = -9999
 473            self.dtype = np.float32
 474            self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 475
 476        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 477        # awi_ant_1km but masked for grounded ice only, using Bedmachine v2 mask
 478        elif self.name == "awi_ant_1km_grounded":
 479            filename = "ant_awi_2013_dem_grounded.npz"
 480            filled_filename = "ant_awi_2013_dem_grounded.npz"
 481            default_dir = f'{os.environ["CPDATA_DIR"]}/SATS/RA/DEMS/ant_awi_2013_dem'
 482            self.src_url = ""
 483            self.src_url_filled = ""
 484            self.dem_version = "1.0"
 485            self.src_institute = "AWI"
 486            self.long_name = "AWI Antarctic DEM (2013), Grounded Ice only"
 487            self.crs_bng = CRS("epsg:3031")  # Polar Stereo - South -71S
 488            self.southern_hemisphere = True
 489            self.void_value = -9999
 490            self.dtype = np.float32
 491            self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 492            self.npz_type = True
 493
 494        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 495        # awi_ant_1km but masked for floating ice only, using Bedmachine v2 mask
 496        elif self.name == "awi_ant_1km_floating":
 497            filename = "ant_awi_2013_dem_floating.npz"
 498            filled_filename = "ant_awi_2013_dem_floating.npz"
 499            default_dir = f'{os.environ["CPDATA_DIR"]}/SATS/RA/DEMS/ant_awi_2013_dem'
 500            self.src_url = ""
 501            self.src_url_filled = ""
 502            self.dem_version = "1.0"
 503            self.src_institute = "AWI"
 504            self.long_name = "AWI Antarctic DEM (2013), Floating Ice only"
 505            self.crs_bng = CRS("epsg:3031")  # Polar Stereo - South -71S
 506            self.southern_hemisphere = True
 507            self.void_value = -9999
 508            self.dtype = np.float32
 509            self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 510            self.npz_type = True
 511        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 512        elif self.name == "awi_grn_1km":
 513            filename = "DEM_GRE_CS_20130826.tif"
 514            filled_filename = "DEM_GRE_CS_20130826.tif"
 515            default_dir = f'{os.environ["CPDATA_DIR"]}/SATS/RA/DEMS/grn_awi_2013_dem'
 516            self.src_url = ""
 517            self.src_url_filled = ""
 518            self.dem_version = "1.0"
 519            self.src_institute = "AWI"
 520            self.long_name = "AWI Greenlabd DEM (2013)"
 521            self.crs_bng = CRS("epsg:3413")  # Polar Stereo - South -71S
 522            self.southern_hemisphere = False
 523            self.void_value = -9999
 524            self.dtype = np.float32
 525            self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 526
 527        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 528        elif self.name == "arcticdem_1km":
 529            # Arctic DEM at 1km resolution
 530
 531            filename = "arcticdem_mosaic_1km_v3.0.tif"
 532            filled_filename = ""

1146    def get_segment(
1147        self, segment_bounds: list, grid_xy: bool = True, flatten: bool = False
1148    ) -> tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
1149        """return a cropped segment of the DEM, flattened or as a grid
1150
1151        Args:
1152            segment_bounds (List): [(minx,maxx),(miny,maxy)]
1153            grid_xy (bool, optional): return segment as a grid. Defaults to True.
1154            flatten (bool, optional): return segment as flattened list. Defaults to False.
1155
1156        Returns:
1157            Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]: (xdem,ydem,zdem)
1158        """
1159
1160        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1161        # Get coord bounds as index bounds
1162        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1163
1164        minx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][0] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1165        maxx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][1] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1166        miny_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][0] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1167        maxy_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][1] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1168
1169        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1170        # Crop full dem coords to segment bounds
1171        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1172
1173        zdem = self.zdem[maxy_ind:miny_ind, minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1174        xdem = self.xdem[minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1175        ydem = self.ydem[maxy_ind:miny_ind]
1176
1177        if grid_xy is True:
1178            xdem, ydem = np.meshgrid(xdem, ydem)
1179
1180            # Set x,y to nan where z is nan
1181            zdem_nan = np.isnan(zdem)
1182            xdem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1183            ydem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1184
1185        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1186        # Return, flattened if requested
1187        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1188
1189        if flatten is False:
1190            return (xdem, ydem, zdem)
1191
1192        return (xdem.flatten(), ydem.flatten(), zdem.flatten())
1193
1194    def chunked_interpolation(
1195        self, x: np.ndarray, y: np.ndarray, myydem: np.ndarray, xdem: np.ndarray, method: str
1196    ) -> np.ndarray:
1197        """Interpolate DEM in chunks to handle large datasets efficiently.
1198
1199        This function performs interpolation on a DEM stored in a Zarr array by
1200        extracting relevant chunks and creating a sub-grid for interpolation.
1201
1202        Args:
1203            x (np.ndarray): Array of x coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1204            y (np.ndarray): Array of y coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1205            myydem (np.ndarray): Flipped y coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1206            xdem (np.ndarray): x coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1207            method (str): Interpolation method to use ('linear', 'nearest', etc.).
1208
1209        Returns:
1210            np.ndarray: Interpolated DEM elevation values at the specified coordinates.
1211        """
1212        results = np.full_like(x, np.nan, dtype=np.float64)
1213
1214        # Identify valid points (where x and y are not NaN)
1215        valid_mask = ~np.isnan(x) & ~np.isnan(y)
1216
1217        # Only proceed if there are valid points
1218        if valid_mask.any():
1219            x_valid = x[valid_mask]
1220            y_valid = y[valid_mask]
1221
1222            # Define the bounding box for valid points
1223            x_min, x_max = x_valid.min(), x_valid.max()
1224            y_min, y_max = y_valid.min(), y_valid.max()
1225
1226            # Determine the indices of the bounding box in the DEM grid
1227            x_indices = np.searchsorted(xdem, [x_min, x_max])
1228            y_indices = np.searchsorted(myydem, [y_min, y_max])
1229
1230            # Expand the indices to ensure we cover the region adequately
1231            x_indices[0] = max(x_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1232            x_indices[1] = min(x_indices[1] + 1, len(xdem) - 1)
1233            y_indices[0] = max(y_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1234            y_indices[1] = min(y_indices[1] + 1, len(myydem) - 1)
1235
1236            # Extract the sub-array
1237            sub_zarr = self.zdem_flip[
1238                y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1, x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1
1239            ]
1240            sub_zarr = np.array(sub_zarr)
1241
1242            sub_myydem = myydem[y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1]
1243            sub_xdem = xdem[x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1]
1244
1245            # Create an interpolator for the sub-array
1246            interpolator = RegularGridInterpolator(
1247                (sub_myydem, sub_xdem),
1248                sub_zarr,
1249                method=method,
1250                bounds_error=False,
1251                fill_value=np.nan,
1252            )
1253
1254            # Perform the interpolation for valid points
1255            points = np.vstack((y_valid, x_valid)).T
1256            interpolated_values = interpolator(points)
1257
1258            # Store the results in the corresponding places
1259            results[valid_mask] = interpolated_values
1260
1261        return results
1262
1263    # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1264    # Interpolate DEM, input x,y can be arrays or single, units m, in projection (epsg:3031")
1265    # returns the interpolated elevation(s) at x,y
1266    # x,y : x,y cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m
1267    # OR, when xy_is_latlon is True:
1268    # x,y : latitude, longitude values in degs N and E (note the order, not longitude, latitude!)
1269    #
1270    # method: string containing the interpolation method. Default is 'linear'. Options are
1271    # linear and nearest, and splinef2d (see scipy.interpolate.interpn docs).
1272    #
1273    # Where your input points are outside the DEM area, then np.nan values will be returned
1274    # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1275
1276    def interp_dem(self, x, y, method="linear", xy_is_latlon=False) -> np.ndarray:
1277        """Interpolate DEM to return elevation values corresponding to
1278           cartesian x,y in DEM's projection or lat,lon values
1279
1280        Args:
1281            x (np.ndarray): x cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m, or lat values
1282            y (np.ndarray): x cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m, or lon values
1283            method (str, optional): linear, nearest, splinef2d. Defaults to "linear".
1284            xy_is_latlon (bool, optional): if True, x,y are lat, lon values. Defaults to False.
1285
1286        Returns:
1287            np.ndarray: interpolated dem elevation values
1288        """
1289
1290        x = np.array(x)
1291        y = np.array(y)
1292
1293        # Transform to x,y if inputs are lat,lon
1294        if xy_is_latlon:
1295            x, y = self.lonlat_to_xy_transformer.transform(  # pylint: disable=E0633
1296                y, x
1297            )  # transform lon,lat -> x,y
1298        myydem = np.flip(self.ydem.copy())
1299        # If zdem is actually a zarr array instead of a numpy array
1300        # then we use the pre-flipped zarr version, but need to convert it to
1301        # a numpy array first (which is slow)
1302        if self.zarr_type:
1303            return self.chunked_interpolation(x, y, myydem, self.xdem, method)
1304
1305        myzdem = np.flip(self.zdem.copy(), 0)
1306        return interpn(
1307            (myydem, self.xdem),
1308            myzdem,
1309            (y, x),
1310            method=method,
1311            bounds_error=False,
1312            fill_value=np.nan,
1313        )
1314
1315    def gaussian_smooth(self, sigma=1.0):
1316        """
1317        perform a gaussian smooth on the current loaded DEM
1318        sigma : degree of smoothing, def=1.0
1319        """
1320        # Gaussian smooth DEM
1321        this_zdem = self.zdem.copy()
1322        this_zdem[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1323        f_zdem = gaussian_filter(this_zdem, sigma=sigma)
1324        www = 0 * self.zdem.copy() + 1
1325        www[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1326        f_www = gaussian_filter(www, sigma=sigma)
1327        self.zdem = f_zdem / f_www
1328
1329    def hillshade(self, azimuth=225, pitch=45):
1330        """
1331        Convert the DEM 'z_dem' values to a hillshade value between 0..255
1332        azimuth: angle in degrees (0..360)
1333        pitch : angle in degrees (0..90)
1334        """
1335        azimuth = 360.0 - azimuth
1336
1337        x, y = np.gradient(self.zdem)
1338        slope = np.pi / 2.0 - np.arctan(np.sqrt(x * x + y * y))
1339        aspect = np.arctan2(-x, y)
1340        azimuthrad = azimuth * np.pi / 180.0
1341        altituderad = pitch * np.pi / 180.0
1342
1343        shaded = np.sin(altituderad) * np.sin(slope) + np.cos(altituderad) * np.cos(slope) * np.cos(
1344            (azimuthrad - np.pi / 2.0) - aspect
1345        )
1346
1347        self.zdem = 255 * (shaded + 1) / 2

  75    def __init__(
  76        self,
  77        name: str,
  78        filled: bool = True,
  79        config: None | dict = None,
  80        dem_dir: str | None = None,
  81        store_in_shared_memory: bool = False,
  82        thislog: logging.Logger | None = None,
  83    ):
  84        """class initialization function
  85
  86        Args:
  87            name (str): DEM name id, must be in global dem_list
  88            filled (bool, optional): Use filled version of DEM if True. Defaults to True.
  89            config (dict, optional): configuration dictionary, defaults to None
  90            dem_dir (str, optional): path of directory containing DEM. Defaults to None
  91            store_in_shared_memory (bool, optional): stores/accesses zdem array in SharedMemory
  92            thislog (logging.Logger|None, optional): attach to a different log instance
  93        Raises:
  94            ValueError: when name not in global dem_list
  95        """
  96        self.name = name
  97        self.crs_wgs = CRS("epsg:4326")  # we are using WGS84 for all DEMs
  98        self.config = config
  99        self.name = name
 100        self.dem_dir = dem_dir
 101        self.filled = filled
 102        self.reference_year = 0  # YYYY, the year the DEM's elevations are referenced to
 103        self.xdem = np.array([])
 104        self.ydem = np.array([])
 105        self.zdem: zarr.core.Array | np.ndarray = np.array([])
 106        self.zdem_flip: zarr.core.Array | np.ndarray = np.array([])
 107        self.mindemx = None
 108        self.mindemy = None
 109        self.binsize = 0
 110        self.store_in_shared_memory = store_in_shared_memory
 111        self.shape = ()
 112        self.dtype = np.float32
 113        self.shared_mem: Any = None
 114        self.shared_mem_child = False  # set to True if a child process
 115        self.npz_type = False  # set to True when using .npz DEM file
 116        self.zarr_type = False  # set to True when using .zarr DEM file
 117        self.nc_type = False  # set to True when using .nc DEM file
 118        self.zflip = True  # whether self.zdem needs flipping
 119        self.void_value: float | int = -3267
 120
 121        # is accessing the Dem's shared memory
 122        # default is False (parent process which allocates
 123        # the shared memory). Necessary for tracking who
 124        # unlinks (parent) or closes (child) the shared
 125        # memory at the end
 126        if thislog is not None:
 127            self.log = thislog  # optionally attach to a different log instance
 128        else:
 129            self.log = log
 130
 131        if name not in dem_list:
 132            self.log.error("DEM %s not in allowed list", name)
 133            raise ValueError(f"DEM name {name} not in allowed list")
 134
 135        self.load()
 136
 137    def get_nc_extent(self, fname: str):
 138        """get the DEM extent from nc file
 139
 140        Args:
 141            fname (str): path of GeoTIFF file
 142
 143        Raises:
 144            ValueError: _description_
 145            IOError: _description_
 146
 147        Returns:
 148            tuple(int,int,int,int,int,int,int): width,height,top_left,top_right,bottom_left,
 149            bottom_right,pixel_width
 150        """
 151
 152        nc = Dataset(fname)
 153        height, width = np.shape(nc["h"])
 154        top_left = (np.min(nc["x"][:]), np.max(nc["y"][:]))
 155        top_right = (np.max(nc["x"][:]), np.max(nc["y"][:]))
 156        bottom_left = (np.min(nc["x"][:]), np.min(nc["y"][:]))
 157        bottom_right = (np.max(nc["y"][:]), np.min(nc["y"][:]))
 158        pixel_width = nc["x"][:][1] - nc["x"][:][0]
 159
 160        print(
 161            width,
 162            height,
 163            top_left,
 164            top_right,
 165            bottom_left,
 166            bottom_right,
 167            pixel_width,
 168        )
 169
 170        return (
 171            width,
 172            height,
 173            top_left,
 174            top_right,
 175            bottom_left,
 176            bottom_right,
 177            pixel_width,
 178        )
 179
 180    def get_geotiff_extent(self, fname: str):
 181        """Get info from GeoTIFF on its extent
 182
 183        Args:
 184            fname (str): path of GeoTIFF file
 185
 186        Raises:
 187            ValueError: _description_
 188            IOError: _description_
 189
 190        Returns:
 191            tuple(int,int,int,int,int,int,int): width,height,top_left,top_right,bottom_left,
 192            bottom_right,pixel_width
 193        """
 194        try:
 195            with rasterio.open(fname) as dataset:
 196                transform = dataset.transform
 197                width = dataset.width
 198                height = dataset.height
 199
 200                top_left = transform * (0, 0)
 201                top_right = transform * (width, 0)
 202                bottom_left = transform * (0, height)
 203                bottom_right = transform * (width, height)
 204
 205                pixel_width = transform[0]
 206                pixel_height = -transform[4]  # Negative because the height is
 207                # typically negative in GeoTIFFs
 208                if int(pixel_width) != int(pixel_height):
 209                    raise ValueError(f"pixel_width {pixel_width} != pixel_height {pixel_height}")
 210        except RasterioIOError as exc:
 211            raise IOError(f"Could not read GeoTIFF: {exc}") from exc
 212        return (
 213            width,
 214            height,
 215            top_left,
 216            top_right,
 217            bottom_left,
 218            bottom_right,
 219            pixel_width,
 220        )
 221
 222    def get_filename(self, default_dir: str, filename: str, filled_filename: str) -> str:
 223        """Find the path of the DEM file from dir and file names :
 224        For the directory, it is chosen in order of preference:
 225        a) self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name], or
 226        b) supplied self.dem_dir, or
 227        c) default_dir
 228        The file name is:
 229        filename: is self.filled use filled_filename
 230
 231        Args:
 232            default_dir (str): default dir to find DEM file names
 233            filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
 234            filled_filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
 235        Returns:
 236            str : path of DEM file
 237        Raises:
 238            OSError : directory or file not found
 239        """
 240        this_dem_dir = None
 241        if self.config:
 242            if "dem_dirs" in self.config and self.name in self.config["dem_dirs"]:
 243                this_dem_dir = self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name]
 244        if this_dem_dir is None and self.dem_dir:
 245            this_dem_dir = self.dem_dir
 246        if this_dem_dir is None:
 247            this_dem_dir = default_dir
 248
 249        if not os.path.isdir(this_dem_dir):
 250            raise OSError(f"{this_dem_dir} not found")
 251        if self.filled and filled_filename:
 252            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filled_filename}"
 253        else:
 254            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filename}"
 255
 256        self.log.info("Loading dem name: %s", self.name)
 257        self.log.info("Loading dem file: %s", this_path)
 258
 259        if self.zarr_type:
 260            if not os.path.isdir(this_path):
 261                raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
 262        elif not os.path.isfile(this_path):
 263            raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
 264
 265        return this_path
 266
 267    def clean_up(self):
 268        """Free up, close or release any shared memory or other resources associated
 269        with DEM
 270        """
 271        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
 272            try:
 273                if self.shared_mem is not None:
 274                    if self.shared_mem_child:
 275                        self.shared_mem.close()
 276                        self.log.info("closed shared memory for %s", self.name)
 277                    else:
 278                        self.shared_mem.close()
 279                        self.shared_mem.unlink()
 280                        self.log.info("unlinked shared memory for %s", self.name)
 281
 282            except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-exception-caught
 283                self.log.error("Shared memory for %s could not be closed %s", self.name, exc)
 284        else:
 285            if self.zarr_type:
 286                self.zdem = None
 287                self.zdem_flip = None
 288
 289    def load_npz(self, npz_file: str):
 290        """Load DEM from npz format file
 291
 292        Args:
 293            npz_file (str): path of npz file
 294        """
 295        data = np.load(npz_file, allow_pickle=True)
 296        self.zdem = data["zdem"]
 297        self.xdem = data["xdem"]
 298        self.ydem = data["ydem"]
 299        self.mindemx = data["mindemx"]
 300        self.mindemy = data["mindemy"]
 301        self.binsize = data["binsize"]
 302
 303    def load_zarr(self, demfile: str):
 304        """Load a .zarr file
 305
 306        Args:
 307            demfile (str): path of .zarr file
 308        """
 309
 310        try:
 311            self.zdem = zarr.open_array(demfile, mode="r")
 312        except Exception as exc:
 313            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc
 314
 315        ncols = self.zdem.attrs["ncols"]
 316        nrows = self.zdem.attrs["nrows"]
 317
 318        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
 319
 320        for key in self.zdem.attrs:
 321            print(key, self.zdem.attrs[key])
 322
 323        top_l = self.zdem.attrs["top_l"]
 324        top_r = self.zdem.attrs["top_r"]
 325        bottom_l = self.zdem.attrs["bottom_l"]
 326        binsize = self.zdem.attrs["binsize"]
 327
 328        print(
 329            ncols,
 330            nrows,
 331            top_l,
 332            top_r,
 333            bottom_l,
 334            binsize,
 335        )
 336
 337        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 338        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 339        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 340        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 341        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 342        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 343
 344        try:
 345            self.zdem_flip = zarr.open_array(demfile.replace(".zarr", "_flipped.zarr"), mode="r")
 346        except Exception as exc:
 347            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc
 348
 349    def load_nc(self, demfile: str):
 350        """Load a netcdf file
 351
 352        Args:
 353            demfile (str): path of netcdf file
 354        """
 355        (
 356            ncols,
 357            nrows,
 358            top_l,
 359            top_r,
 360            bottom_l,
 361            _,
 362            binsize,
 363        ) = self.get_nc_extent(demfile)
 364
 365        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
 366
 367        nc = Dataset(demfile)
 368        zdem = nc["h"][:].data
 369
 370        if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 371            raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
 372        self.zdem = zdem
 373
 374        # Set void data to Nan
 375        if self.void_value:
 376            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
 377            if np.any(void_data):
 378                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
 379
 380        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 381        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 382        # self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 383        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 384        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 385        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 386
 387    def load_geotiff(self, demfile: str):
 388        """Load a GeoTIFF file
 389
 390        Args:
 391            demfile (str): path of GeoTIFF
 392        """
 393        (
 394            ncols,
 395            nrows,
 396            top_l,
 397            top_r,
 398            bottom_l,
 399            _,
 400            binsize,
 401        ) = self.get_geotiff_extent(demfile)
 402
 403        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
 404            # First try attaching to an existing shared memory buffer if it
 405            # exists with the DEMs name. If that is unavailable, create the shared memory
 406            try:
 407                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=False)
 408                self.zdem = np.ndarray(
 409                    shape=(nrows, ncols), dtype=self.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf
 410                )
 411                self.shared_mem_child = True
 412
 413                self.log.info("attached to existing shared memory for %s ", self.name)
 414
 415            except FileNotFoundError as exc:
 416                zdem = imread(demfile)
 417
 418                if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 419                    raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}") from exc
 420
 421                # Create the shared memory with the appropriate size
 422                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=True, size=zdem.nbytes)
 423
 424                # Link the shared memory to the zdem data
 425                self.zdem = np.ndarray(zdem.shape, dtype=zdem.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf)
 426
 427                # Copy the data from zdem to the shared_np_array
 428                self.zdem[:] = zdem[:]
 429
 430                self.log.info("created shared memory for %s", self.name)
 431        else:
 432            zdem = imread(demfile)
 433            if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
 434                raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
 435            self.zdem = zdem
 436
 437        # Set void data to Nan
 438        if self.void_value:
 439            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
 440            if np.any(void_data):
 441                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
 442
 443        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
 444        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
 445        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
 446        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
 447        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
 448        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
 449

1147    def get_segment(
1148        self, segment_bounds: list, grid_xy: bool = True, flatten: bool = False
1149    ) -> tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
1150        """return a cropped segment of the DEM, flattened or as a grid
1151
1152        Args:
1153            segment_bounds (List): [(minx,maxx),(miny,maxy)]
1154            grid_xy (bool, optional): return segment as a grid. Defaults to True.
1155            flatten (bool, optional): return segment as flattened list. Defaults to False.
1156
1157        Returns:
1158            Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]: (xdem,ydem,zdem)
1159        """
1160
1161        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1162        # Get coord bounds as index bounds
1163        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1164
1165        minx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][0] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1166        maxx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][1] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1167        miny_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][0] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1168        maxy_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][1] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1169
1170        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1171        # Crop full dem coords to segment bounds
1172        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1173
1174        zdem = self.zdem[maxy_ind:miny_ind, minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1175        xdem = self.xdem[minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1176        ydem = self.ydem[maxy_ind:miny_ind]
1177
1178        if grid_xy is True:
1179            xdem, ydem = np.meshgrid(xdem, ydem)
1180
1181            # Set x,y to nan where z is nan
1182            zdem_nan = np.isnan(zdem)
1183            xdem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1184            ydem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1185
1186        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1187        # Return, flattened if requested
1188        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1189
1190        if flatten is False:
1191            return (xdem, ydem, zdem)
1192
1193        return (xdem.flatten(), ydem.flatten(), zdem.flatten())
1194
1195    def chunked_interpolation(
1196        self, x: np.ndarray, y: np.ndarray, myydem: np.ndarray, xdem: np.ndarray, method: str
1197    ) -> np.ndarray:
1198        """Interpolate DEM in chunks to handle large datasets efficiently.
1199
1200        This function performs interpolation on a DEM stored in a Zarr array by
1201        extracting relevant chunks and creating a sub-grid for interpolation.
1202
1203        Args:
1204            x (np.ndarray): Array of x coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1205            y (np.ndarray): Array of y coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1206            myydem (np.ndarray): Flipped y coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1207            xdem (np.ndarray): x coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1208            method (str): Interpolation method to use ('linear', 'nearest', etc.).
1209
1210        Returns:
1211            np.ndarray: Interpolated DEM elevation values at the specified coordinates.
1212        """
1213        results = np.full_like(x, np.nan, dtype=np.float64)
1214
1215        # Identify valid points (where x and y are not NaN)
1216        valid_mask = ~np.isnan(x) & ~np.isnan(y)
1217
1218        # Only proceed if there are valid points
1219        if valid_mask.any():
1220            x_valid = x[valid_mask]
1221            y_valid = y[valid_mask]
1222
1223            # Define the bounding box for valid points
1224            x_min, x_max = x_valid.min(), x_valid.max()
1225            y_min, y_max = y_valid.min(), y_valid.max()
1226
1227            # Determine the indices of the bounding box in the DEM grid
1228            x_indices = np.searchsorted(xdem, [x_min, x_max])
1229            y_indices = np.searchsorted(myydem, [y_min, y_max])
1230
1231            # Expand the indices to ensure we cover the region adequately
1232            x_indices[0] = max(x_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1233            x_indices[1] = min(x_indices[1] + 1, len(xdem) - 1)
1234            y_indices[0] = max(y_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1235            y_indices[1] = min(y_indices[1] + 1, len(myydem) - 1)
1236
1237            # Extract the sub-array
1238            sub_zarr = self.zdem_flip[
1239                y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1, x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1
1240            ]
1241            sub_zarr = np.array(sub_zarr)
1242
1243            sub_myydem = myydem[y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1]
1244            sub_xdem = xdem[x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1]
1245
1246            # Create an interpolator for the sub-array
1247            interpolator = RegularGridInterpolator(
1248                (sub_myydem, sub_xdem),
1249                sub_zarr,
1250                method=method,
1251                bounds_error=False,
1252                fill_value=np.nan,
1253            )
1254
1255            # Perform the interpolation for valid points
1256            points = np.vstack((y_valid, x_valid)).T
1257            interpolated_values = interpolator(points)
1258
1259            # Store the results in the corresponding places
1260            results[valid_mask] = interpolated_values
1261
1262        return results
1263
1264    # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1265    # Interpolate DEM, input x,y can be arrays or single, units m, in projection (epsg:3031")
1266    # returns the interpolated elevation(s) at x,y
1267    # x,y : x,y cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m
1268    # OR, when xy_is_latlon is True:
1269    # x,y : latitude, longitude values in degs N and E (note the order, not longitude, latitude!)
1270    #
1271    # method: string containing the interpolation method. Default is 'linear'. Options are
1272    # linear and nearest, and splinef2d (see scipy.interpolate.interpn docs).
1273    #
1274    # Where your input points are outside the DEM area, then np.nan values will be returned
1275    # ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1276
1277    def interp_dem(self, x, y, method="linear", xy_is_latlon=False) -> np.ndarray:
1278        """Interpolate DEM to return elevation values corresponding to
1279           cartesian x,y in DEM's projection or lat,lon values
1280
1281        Args:
1282            x (np.ndarray): x cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m, or lat values
1283            y (np.ndarray): x cartesian coordinates in the DEM's projection in m, or lon values
1284            method (str, optional): linear, nearest, splinef2d. Defaults to "linear".
1285            xy_is_latlon (bool, optional): if True, x,y are lat, lon values. Defaults to False.
1286
1287        Returns:
1288            np.ndarray: interpolated dem elevation values
1289        """
1290
1291        x = np.array(x)
1292        y = np.array(y)
1293
1294        # Transform to x,y if inputs are lat,lon
1295        if xy_is_latlon:
1296            x, y = self.lonlat_to_xy_transformer.transform(  # pylint: disable=E0633
1297                y, x
1298            )  # transform lon,lat -> x,y
1299        myydem = np.flip(self.ydem.copy())
1300        # If zdem is actually a zarr array instead of a numpy array
1301        # then we use the pre-flipped zarr version, but need to convert it to
1302        # a numpy array first (which is slow)
1303        if self.zarr_type:
1304            return self.chunked_interpolation(x, y, myydem, self.xdem, method)
1305
1306        myzdem = np.flip(self.zdem.copy(), 0)
1307        return interpn(
1308            (myydem, self.xdem),
1309            myzdem,
1310            (y, x),
1311            method=method,
1312            bounds_error=False,
1313            fill_value=np.nan,
1314        )
1315
1316    def gaussian_smooth(self, sigma=1.0):
1317        """
1318        perform a gaussian smooth on the current loaded DEM
1319        sigma : degree of smoothing, def=1.0
1320        """
1321        # Gaussian smooth DEM
1322        this_zdem = self.zdem.copy()
1323        this_zdem[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1324        f_zdem = gaussian_filter(this_zdem, sigma=sigma)
1325        www = 0 * self.zdem.copy() + 1
1326        www[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1327        f_www = gaussian_filter(www, sigma=sigma)
1328        self.zdem = f_zdem / f_www
1329
1330    def hillshade(self, azimuth=225, pitch=45):
1331        """
1332        Convert the DEM 'z_dem' values to a hillshade value between 0..255
1333        azimuth: angle in degrees (0..360)
1334        pitch : angle in degrees (0..90)
1335        """
1336        azimuth = 360.0 - azimuth
1337
1338        x, y = np.gradient(self.zdem)
1339        slope = np.pi / 2.0 - np.arctan(np.sqrt(x * x + y * y))
1340        aspect = np.arctan2(-x, y)
1341        azimuthrad = azimuth * np.pi / 180.0
1342        altituderad = pitch * np.pi / 180.0
1343
1344        shaded = np.sin(altituderad) * np.sin(slope) + np.cos(altituderad) * np.cos(slope) * np.cos(
1345            (azimuthrad - np.pi / 2.0) - aspect
1346        )
1347
1348        self.zdem = 255 * (shaded + 1) / 2

def get_geotiff_extent(self, fname: str): 
180    def get_geotiff_extent(self, fname: str):
181        """Get info from GeoTIFF on its extent
182
183        Args:
184            fname (str): path of GeoTIFF file
185
186        Raises:
187            ValueError: _description_
188            IOError: _description_
189
190        Returns:
191            tuple(int,int,int,int,int,int,int): width,height,top_left,top_right,bottom_left,
192            bottom_right,pixel_width
193        """
194        try:
195            with rasterio.open(fname) as dataset:
196                transform = dataset.transform
197                width = dataset.width
198                height = dataset.height
199
200                top_left = transform * (0, 0)
201                top_right = transform * (width, 0)
202                bottom_left = transform * (0, height)
203                bottom_right = transform * (width, height)
204
205                pixel_width = transform[0]
206                pixel_height = -transform[4]  # Negative because the height is
207                # typically negative in GeoTIFFs
208                if int(pixel_width) != int(pixel_height):
209                    raise ValueError(f"pixel_width {pixel_width} != pixel_height {pixel_height}")
210        except RasterioIOError as exc:
211            raise IOError(f"Could not read GeoTIFF: {exc}") from exc
212        return (
213            width,
214            height,
215            top_left,
216            top_right,
217            bottom_left,
218            bottom_right,
219            pixel_width,
220        )

def get_filename(self, default_dir: str, filename: str, filled_filename: str) -> str: 
222    def get_filename(self, default_dir: str, filename: str, filled_filename: str) -> str:
223        """Find the path of the DEM file from dir and file names :
224        For the directory, it is chosen in order of preference:
225        a) self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name], or
226        b) supplied self.dem_dir, or
227        c) default_dir
228        The file name is:
229        filename: is self.filled use filled_filename
230
231        Args:
232            default_dir (str): default dir to find DEM file names
233            filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
234            filled_filename (str): file name of DEM (not filled)
235        Returns:
236            str : path of DEM file
237        Raises:
238            OSError : directory or file not found
239        """
240        this_dem_dir = None
241        if self.config:
242            if "dem_dirs" in self.config and self.name in self.config["dem_dirs"]:
243                this_dem_dir = self.config["dem_dirs"][self.name]
244        if this_dem_dir is None and self.dem_dir:
245            this_dem_dir = self.dem_dir
246        if this_dem_dir is None:
247            this_dem_dir = default_dir
248
249        if not os.path.isdir(this_dem_dir):
250            raise OSError(f"{this_dem_dir} not found")
251        if self.filled and filled_filename:
252            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filled_filename}"
253        else:
254            this_path = f"{this_dem_dir}/{filename}"
255
256        self.log.info("Loading dem name: %s", self.name)
257        self.log.info("Loading dem file: %s", this_path)
258
259        if self.zarr_type:
260            if not os.path.isdir(this_path):
261                raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
262        elif not os.path.isfile(this_path):
263            raise OSError(f"{this_path} not found")
264
265        return this_path

def clean_up(self): 
267    def clean_up(self):
268        """Free up, close or release any shared memory or other resources associated
269        with DEM
270        """
271        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
272            try:
273                if self.shared_mem is not None:
274                    if self.shared_mem_child:
275                        self.shared_mem.close()
276                        self.log.info("closed shared memory for %s", self.name)
277                    else:
278                        self.shared_mem.close()
279                        self.shared_mem.unlink()
280                        self.log.info("unlinked shared memory for %s", self.name)
281
282            except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-exception-caught
283                self.log.error("Shared memory for %s could not be closed %s", self.name, exc)
284        else:
285            if self.zarr_type:
286                self.zdem = None
287                self.zdem_flip = None

Free up, close or release any shared memory or other resources associated with DEM

def load_npz(self, npz_file: str): 
289    def load_npz(self, npz_file: str):
290        """Load DEM from npz format file
291
292        Args:
293            npz_file (str): path of npz file
294        """
295        data = np.load(npz_file, allow_pickle=True)
296        self.zdem = data["zdem"]
297        self.xdem = data["xdem"]
298        self.ydem = data["ydem"]
299        self.mindemx = data["mindemx"]
300        self.mindemy = data["mindemy"]
301        self.binsize = data["binsize"]

Load DEM from npz format file

Arguments:
  • npz_file (str): path of npz file
def load_zarr(self, demfile: str): 
303    def load_zarr(self, demfile: str):
304        """Load a .zarr file
305
306        Args:
307            demfile (str): path of .zarr file
308        """
309
310        try:
311            self.zdem = zarr.open_array(demfile, mode="r")
312        except Exception as exc:
313            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc
314
315        ncols = self.zdem.attrs["ncols"]
316        nrows = self.zdem.attrs["nrows"]
317
318        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
319
320        for key in self.zdem.attrs:
321            print(key, self.zdem.attrs[key])
322
323        top_l = self.zdem.attrs["top_l"]
324        top_r = self.zdem.attrs["top_r"]
325        bottom_l = self.zdem.attrs["bottom_l"]
326        binsize = self.zdem.attrs["binsize"]
327
328        print(
329            ncols,
330            nrows,
331            top_l,
332            top_r,
333            bottom_l,
334            binsize,
335        )
336
337        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
338        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
339        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
340        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
341        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
342        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m
343
344        try:
345            self.zdem_flip = zarr.open_array(demfile.replace(".zarr", "_flipped.zarr"), mode="r")
346        except Exception as exc:
347            raise IOError(f"Failed to open Zarr file: {demfile} {exc}") from exc

Load a .zarr file

def load_nc(self, demfile: str): 
349    def load_nc(self, demfile: str):
350        """Load a netcdf file
351
352        Args:
353            demfile (str): path of netcdf file
354        """
355        (
356            ncols,
357            nrows,
358            top_l,
359            top_r,
360            bottom_l,
361            _,
362            binsize,
363        ) = self.get_nc_extent(demfile)
364
365        print(f"ncols {ncols} nrows {nrows}")
366
367        nc = Dataset(demfile)
368        zdem = nc["h"][:].data
369
370        if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
371            raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
372        self.zdem = zdem
373
374        # Set void data to Nan
375        if self.void_value:
376            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
377            if np.any(void_data):
378                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
379
380        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
381        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
382        # self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
383        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
384        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
385        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m

Load a netcdf file

Arguments:
  • demfile (str): path of netcdf file
def load_geotiff(self, demfile: str): 
387    def load_geotiff(self, demfile: str):
388        """Load a GeoTIFF file
389
390        Args:
391            demfile (str): path of GeoTIFF
392        """
393        (
394            ncols,
395            nrows,
396            top_l,
397            top_r,
398            bottom_l,
399            _,
400            binsize,
401        ) = self.get_geotiff_extent(demfile)
402
403        if self.store_in_shared_memory:
404            # First try attaching to an existing shared memory buffer if it
405            # exists with the DEMs name. If that is unavailable, create the shared memory
406            try:
407                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=False)
408                self.zdem = np.ndarray(
409                    shape=(nrows, ncols), dtype=self.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf
410                )
411                self.shared_mem_child = True
412
413                self.log.info("attached to existing shared memory for %s ", self.name)
414
415            except FileNotFoundError as exc:
416                zdem = imread(demfile)
417
418                if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
419                    raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}") from exc
420
421                # Create the shared memory with the appropriate size
422                self.shared_mem = SharedMemory(name=self.name, create=True, size=zdem.nbytes)
423
424                # Link the shared memory to the zdem data
425                self.zdem = np.ndarray(zdem.shape, dtype=zdem.dtype, buffer=self.shared_mem.buf)
426
427                # Copy the data from zdem to the shared_np_array
428                self.zdem[:] = zdem[:]
429
430                self.log.info("created shared memory for %s", self.name)
431        else:
432            zdem = imread(demfile)
433            if not isinstance(zdem, np.ndarray):
434                raise TypeError(f"DEM image type not supported : {type(zdem)}")
435            self.zdem = zdem
436
437        # Set void data to Nan
438        if self.void_value:
439            void_data = np.where(self.zdem == self.void_value)
440            if np.any(void_data):
441                self.zdem[void_data] = np.nan
442
443        self.xdem = np.linspace(top_l[0], top_r[0], ncols, endpoint=True)
444        self.ydem = np.linspace(bottom_l[1], top_l[1], nrows, endpoint=True)
445        self.ydem = np.flip(self.ydem)
446        self.mindemx = self.xdem.min()
447        self.mindemy = self.ydem.min()
448        self.binsize = binsize  # grid resolution in m

1116        # --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1117
1118        else:
1119            raise ValueError(f"{self.name} is not a supported DEM name")
1120
1121        # Form the DEM file name and load the DEM
1122        try:
1123            demfile = self.get_filename(default_dir, filename, filled_filename)
1124        except OSError as exc:
1125            self.log.error("Could not form dem path for %s : %s", self.name, exc)
1126            return False
1127
1128        if self.npz_type:
1129            self.load_npz(demfile)
1130        elif self.zarr_type:
1131            self.load_zarr(demfile)
1132        elif self.nc_type:
1133            self.load_nc(demfile)
1134        else:
1135            self.load_geotiff(demfile)
1136
1137        # Setup the Transforms
1138        self.xy_to_lonlat_transformer = Transformer.from_proj(
1139            self.crs_bng, self.crs_wgs, always_xy=True
1140        )
1141        self.lonlat_to_xy_transformer = Transformer.from_proj(
1142            self.crs_wgs, self.crs_bng, always_xy=True
1143        )
1144
1145        return True

load the DEM

Returns:

bool: DEM loaded ok (True), failed (False)

def get_segment( self, segment_bounds: list, grid_xy: bool = True, flatten: bool = False) -> tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]: 
1147    def get_segment(
1148        self, segment_bounds: list, grid_xy: bool = True, flatten: bool = False
1149    ) -> tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
1150        """return a cropped segment of the DEM, flattened or as a grid
1151
1152        Args:
1153            segment_bounds (List): [(minx,maxx),(miny,maxy)]
1154            grid_xy (bool, optional): return segment as a grid. Defaults to True.
1155            flatten (bool, optional): return segment as flattened list. Defaults to False.
1156
1157        Returns:
1158            Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]: (xdem,ydem,zdem)
1159        """
1160
1161        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1162        # Get coord bounds as index bounds
1163        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1164
1165        minx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][0] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1166        maxx_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[0][1] - self.xdem)).argmin()
1167        miny_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][0] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1168        maxy_ind = (np.absolute(segment_bounds[1][1] - self.ydem)).argmin()
1169
1170        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1171        # Crop full dem coords to segment bounds
1172        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1173
1174        zdem = self.zdem[maxy_ind:miny_ind, minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1175        xdem = self.xdem[minx_ind:maxx_ind]
1176        ydem = self.ydem[maxy_ind:miny_ind]
1177
1178        if grid_xy is True:
1179            xdem, ydem = np.meshgrid(xdem, ydem)
1180
1181            # Set x,y to nan where z is nan
1182            zdem_nan = np.isnan(zdem)
1183            xdem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1184            ydem[zdem_nan] = np.nan
1185
1186        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1187        # Return, flattened if requested
1188        # ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1189
1190        if flatten is False:
1191            return (xdem, ydem, zdem)
1192
1193        return (xdem.flatten(), ydem.flatten(), zdem.flatten())

return a cropped segment of the DEM, flattened or as a grid

Arguments:
  • segment_bounds (List): [(minx,maxx),(miny,maxy)]
  • grid_xy (bool, optional): return segment as a grid. Defaults to True.
  • flatten (bool, optional): return segment as flattened list. Defaults to False.
Returns:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]: (xdem,ydem,zdem)

def chunked_interpolation( self, x: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray, myydem: numpy.ndarray, xdem: numpy.ndarray, method: str) -> numpy.ndarray: 
1195    def chunked_interpolation(
1196        self, x: np.ndarray, y: np.ndarray, myydem: np.ndarray, xdem: np.ndarray, method: str
1197    ) -> np.ndarray:
1198        """Interpolate DEM in chunks to handle large datasets efficiently.
1199
1200        This function performs interpolation on a DEM stored in a Zarr array by
1201        extracting relevant chunks and creating a sub-grid for interpolation.
1202
1203        Args:
1204            x (np.ndarray): Array of x coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1205            y (np.ndarray): Array of y coordinates in the DEM's projection (in meters).
1206            myydem (np.ndarray): Flipped y coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1207            xdem (np.ndarray): x coordinates corresponding to the DEM grid.
1208            method (str): Interpolation method to use ('linear', 'nearest', etc.).
1209
1210        Returns:
1211            np.ndarray: Interpolated DEM elevation values at the specified coordinates.
1212        """
1213        results = np.full_like(x, np.nan, dtype=np.float64)
1214
1215        # Identify valid points (where x and y are not NaN)
1216        valid_mask = ~np.isnan(x) & ~np.isnan(y)
1217
1218        # Only proceed if there are valid points
1219        if valid_mask.any():
1220            x_valid = x[valid_mask]
1221            y_valid = y[valid_mask]
1222
1223            # Define the bounding box for valid points
1224            x_min, x_max = x_valid.min(), x_valid.max()
1225            y_min, y_max = y_valid.min(), y_valid.max()
1226
1227            # Determine the indices of the bounding box in the DEM grid
1228            x_indices = np.searchsorted(xdem, [x_min, x_max])
1229            y_indices = np.searchsorted(myydem, [y_min, y_max])
1230
1231            # Expand the indices to ensure we cover the region adequately
1232            x_indices[0] = max(x_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1233            x_indices[1] = min(x_indices[1] + 1, len(xdem) - 1)
1234            y_indices[0] = max(y_indices[0] - 1, 0)
1235            y_indices[1] = min(y_indices[1] + 1, len(myydem) - 1)
1236
1237            # Extract the sub-array
1238            sub_zarr = self.zdem_flip[
1239                y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1, x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1
1240            ]
1241            sub_zarr = np.array(sub_zarr)
1242
1243            sub_myydem = myydem[y_indices[0] : y_indices[1] + 1]
1244            sub_xdem = xdem[x_indices[0] : x_indices[1] + 1]
1245
1246            # Create an interpolator for the sub-array
1247            interpolator = RegularGridInterpolator(
1248                (sub_myydem, sub_xdem),
1249                sub_zarr,
1250                method=method,
1251                bounds_error=False,
1252                fill_value=np.nan,
1253            )
1254
1255            # Perform the interpolation for valid points
1256            points = np.vstack((y_valid, x_valid)).T
1257            interpolated_values = interpolator(points)
1258
1259            # Store the results in the corresponding places
1260            results[valid_mask] = interpolated_values
1261
1262        return results

def gaussian_smooth(self, sigma=1.0): 
1316    def gaussian_smooth(self, sigma=1.0):
1317        """
1318        perform a gaussian smooth on the current loaded DEM
1319        sigma : degree of smoothing, def=1.0
1320        """
1321        # Gaussian smooth DEM
1322        this_zdem = self.zdem.copy()
1323        this_zdem[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1324        f_zdem = gaussian_filter(this_zdem, sigma=sigma)
1325        www = 0 * self.zdem.copy() + 1
1326        www[np.isnan(self.zdem)] = 0
1327        f_www = gaussian_filter(www, sigma=sigma)
1328        self.zdem = f_zdem / f_www

def hillshade(self, azimuth=225, pitch=45): 
1330    def hillshade(self, azimuth=225, pitch=45):
1331        """
1332        Convert the DEM 'z_dem' values to a hillshade value between 0..255
1333        azimuth: angle in degrees (0..360)
1334        pitch : angle in degrees (0..90)
1335        """
1336        azimuth = 360.0 - azimuth
1337
1338        x, y = np.gradient(self.zdem)
1339        slope = np.pi / 2.0 - np.arctan(np.sqrt(x * x + y * y))
1340        aspect = np.arctan2(-x, y)
1341        azimuthrad = azimuth * np.pi / 180.0
1342        altituderad = pitch * np.pi / 180.0
1343
1344        shaded = np.sin(altituderad) * np.sin(slope) + np.cos(altituderad) * np.cos(slope) * np.cos(
1345            (azimuthrad - np.pi / 2.0) - aspect
1346        )
1347
1348        self.zdem = 255 * (shaded + 1) / 2
